meanings.definition: The action or process of combining a number of things into a single more effective or coherent whole.
meanings.sent1: The consolidations of various departments improved efficiency in the company.
meanings.sent2: The consolidations of data from different sources helped create a comprehensive report.
meanings.sent3: The office party was a consolidation of fun and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her painting was a consolidation of colors that brought the whole room to life.
meanings.sent5: The consolidation of ingredients in the recipe made it taste even better.

meanings.definition: The action or process of making something stronger or more solid.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise is a key factor in the consolidation of muscles.
meanings.sent2: The consolidation of the foundation made the building more stable.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between them was a consolidation of trust and loyalty.
meanings.sent4: The consolidation of the wall with extra support prevented it from collapsing.
meanings.sent5: The consolidation of knowledge through practice made her skills unbeatable.

meanings.definition: The process of uniting two or more companies into a single entity.
meanings.sent1: The consolidations of the two tech giants created a powerful new corporation.
meanings.sent2: The consolidation of the airlines led to better services for customers.
meanings.sent3: The merger was a consolidation of resources and expertise.
meanings.sent4: The consolidation of the companies resulted in a more competitive market.
meanings.sent5: The consolidation of the businesses brought new opportunities for growth.
